(Same as EAS 385 1)
Instructor is new history faculty Prof. Laura Nenzi.


To establish what constitutes fact, fiction, or fantasy in the history of the samurai we will follow two trajectories: one, the history of Japan's warrior class from its origins to its abolition and, two, the history of the samurai code of honor (bushido) and its enduring appeal through the present day. Themes include the warriors' changing place in society; their fighting techniques at different historical junctions; their values as they transpire from the historical record versus the values that were retroactively attributed to them; warrior governments and strategies pertaining to power and authority; depictions of the samurai in literature, plays, and film; and the politicization of the military past. Previous knowledge of Japanese history and Japanese language skills welcome but not required.
